ARABIC: وَلَوْلَآ إِذْ سَمِعْتُمُوهُ قُلْتُم مَّا يَكُونُ لَنَآ أَن نَّتَكَلَّمَ بِهَٰذَا سُبْحَٰنَكَ هَٰذَا بُهْتَٰنٌ عَظِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Why, when you heard it, did you not say, 'We have no business speaking about this. Glory be to You! This is a terrible slander!'?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Why did you not say when you heard it: "It is not for us to speak of it? God preserve us, it is a great calumny!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Why did you not, as soon as you heard of it, say, "It is not proper for us to utter such a thing? Glory be to Allah! This is a great slander."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Would that on hearing this report, you had said, "We have nothing to say about it. God forbid! It is a serious accusation."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And why was it not that, when you heard it, you would have said, “It does not befit us to speak regarding this; Purity is to You, O Allah – this is a great accusation.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And why did you not, when you heard it, say: "It is not right for us to speak of this. Glory be to You (O Allah)! This is a great lie."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And why did you not, when you heard it, say: It does not beseem us that we should talk of it; glory be to Thee! this is a great calumny?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, 'It is not for us to speak about this; glory be to Thee! This is a mighty calumny'?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Wherefor, when ye heard it, said ye not: It is not for us to speak of this. Glory be to Thee (O Allah)! This is awful calumny.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When you heard it, why did you not say, "It is not right for us to speak of this. God forbid! This is a monstrous slander."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And wherefore, when ye heard it, did ye not say: it is not for us to speak thereof, hallowed be Thou! that is a slander mighty!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And why did you not, when you heard it, say, ‘It is not for us to say such a thing. [O Allah!] You are immaculate! This is a monstrous calumny!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And why did ye not, when ye heard it, say? - "It is not right of us to speak of this: Glory to Allah! this is a most serious slander!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And why did you not, when you heard it, say? "It is not right for us to speak of this. Glory be to You (O Allah) this is a great lie."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When you heard it, why did you not say: 'It is not right for us to speak of this. Exaltations to You! This is a mighty slander'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When you heard it, you should have said, “It is not for us to repeat this. By Your glory, this is a serious slander.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, "It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, [O Allah]; this is a great slander"?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [24:16] And why, when you heard it, did you not say, ‘It is not for us to speak about this. Glory be to You! — this [exclamation] here is meant to indicate amazement — This is an awful calumny?’, [an awful] lie?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Wherefore, when ye heard it) i.e. the slander of 'A'ishah and Safwan, (said ye not: It is not for us to speak of this) we are not permitted to speak about this lie. (Glory be to Thee (0 Allah); This is awful calumny) this is a great lie. 387
